Reviews.Title: While operational, it was great!
Reviews.Author: Zornaphile "Zornaphile"
Reviews.Content: I found the feature set of this hdtv just the ticket for what I was looking for. I was looking for a thin bodied hdtv for bluray and hi-def sports viewing, basically a no frills, quality hdtv viewing experience.With 2 hdmi ports, a usb port, ybr connections, and a coaxial input, I give a thumbs up to connectivity  (some might need more hdmi inputs, but I'm happy with two).The picture quality is fantastic, very nice deep blacks, and no image flicker to speak of. The 600hz refresh rate produces a beautiful, full and detailed image.I found the tv user interface to be straight forward, easy to learn, and easy to use. The menu is very soft on the eyes, and is no ways invasive or annoying.Even the tv volume indicator is well thought out; the readout bar appears vertically on the left side of the screen (which does not block subtitles or sports programming with bottom scrolling tickers) and displays just long enough to view the output yet disappears quickly as to not disturb program viewing.As for the negatives, there where only two to speak of...The first being an auto volume leveling feature which reduces those high volume commercials as compared to main programming. This was a feature I was very glad to see included in this set, yet ultimately was disappointing because I could not tell the difference when this feature was turned on or off.The second negative is a doozy though. Unfortunately, my set died after 6 days of use. The set shut itself off, and would not come back to life.Hopefully, this is just a lemon that fizzed out, and not a reflection of the quality of the product.If this hdtv worked without incident for 5 years, I would give it a five star review. But for now, as it stands, I am skeptical that the replacement of this unit will live through it's one year warranty. I hope I am wrong.

Reviews.Title: Nice tv so far....
Reviews.Author: Jeeves
Reviews.Content: Changing my review to 5 stars...  This thing is used easily 14 hours a day with our family profile.  It looks as great as the day i bought it 5 months ago...Update: It's now been over a month, and I am still happy.  Picture is great, brightness and contrast are excellent!  Internal speakers are weak, but I have a surround system anyway.  Still loving this thing for the price...We bought this TV 2 weeks ago and so far so good...  I bought the extended warranty just in case.  For picture quality all I can say is WOW!!!!  Gorgeous!!!  A bit limited on input ports but has enough for me.  It does give off a bit of heat, but all plasmas seem to do that.  My last Samsung DLP lasted 5 years before the bulb went out.  Trusting for similar reliability here.  The screen is high gloss so some glare problems can exist, depends on your room, and light and window placement...

Reviews.Title: Misleading Specs but Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Five Digits
Reviews.Content: The technical specifications listed on the Samsung website for this TV are completely misleading and incorrect. The website claims there are (2) USB ports in reality there is only (1). Website claims that there are (2) component video inputs in reality there is only (1). Website claims there is a PC input and audio mini jack input in reality there is none. I contacted Samsung directly to address the issue. They reviewed a picture of the back of this TV & also looked at their website and agreed. They had no explanation for the misleading specs and would not commit to making any changes to the website.That being said, the picture quality is great, the best I've seen. So if you don't care about misleading manufacturer specs and only need a few inputs, buy this TV. Otherwise I would invest my money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: J. Allen "Josh"
Reviews.Content: I'll start off with saying this tv was FANTASTIC during its first few weeks.  Colors were vibrant, sharp, and vivid. However, after about a month of viewing a greenish hue began at the bottom left of the screen (took up maybe 8 square inches, 4 inches across x 2 inches high).  Eventually, this grew upwards to the top 3/4 of the tv.  Here's where the nightmare began.  I called Samsungs customer service (I am still under warranty but past the return policy of where I bought it) and they issued a repair ticket in which I was told I would be contacted by a repair service within 48 hours.  2 weeks later, I get a call from a repair man asking to schedule an appointment.  The repairman replaced the panel and the main board 1.5 weeks after his call, but to no avail.  He told me to wait a couple weeks to see if it improves.  It didn't.  I called Samsung back and requested a replacement but they said they won't replace it and could only send out another repairman.  So, I requested another repairman to fix it, but received an e-mail that there was no one in the area that could fix it and to call Samsung back to request a replacement (I'm quite frustrated at this point).  I call them back and the FINALLY acknowledge my replacement request and said I would get a credit at the store where I originally purchased it (I'll comment on this if this doesn't go smoothly).This is the biggest headache I've ever had to deal with regarding customer service.  I know Samsung has it in them to make good products, but now I'll never know.  This is the last Samsung product I will buy.  I will stick to LG/Panasonic for my technology/appliance needs.Pros:  +Good picture while it lasted  +Menus are intuitive and easy to use  +Burn in protection is nice  +Remote is straightforwardCons:  -Picture degraded and developed greenish hue  -Bad Sound (pretty typical with this type of TV)  -Image Retention.  It does disappear but it stuck around longer than other TV's and was harder to get rid of  -Samsung Customer Service is terrible  -Samsung Customer Service is terrible  -Samsung Customer Service is TERRIBLE.Feel free to comment if you have questions and I'll try to answer back.

Reviews.Title: Lasted 4 months.
Reviews.Author: Curious mind
Reviews.Content: We received this TV as a replacement for our old plasma that died (amazing TV, sad to see it die.)  Unfortunately we didn't have time to research the TV before accepting it as a replacement.  The picture quality and sound on this television were very good. We were pleasantly surprised having not owned a Samsung TV, especially with the sound.  The only negative was being limited to two HDMI ports, but that's not a make-or-break issue.However, after four months the unit spontaneously shut itself off and then would not power up again.  Numerous other reviews reported similar problems.  A tech came out to replace one of the boards, but that did not solve the issue.  Now we are awaiting replacement of the plasma panel.  Hopefully this solves the issue, we will see.  Thankfully we had an extended warranty.  I would not recommend buying this product.

Reviews.Title: Updated.. Failed after one year..
Reviews.Author: Silenced Within
Reviews.Content: Purchased mine at the end of October 2011, and still loving it!! Upgraded from a Sanyo 42" 1080p LCD that we have used since 2008. Was unsure about the Plasma because of all the "Screen Burn" issues. Not really a big deal, just have pay a bit more attention to what your doing than you would w/ an LCD. I ONLY watch television and movies on this TV. No video games. After watching a movie (and believe me, we watch TONS) there is a bit of the black bars retained on the top and bottom of the screen, but simply switching to TV and letting it play on a channel w/ no reception (SNOW) for about three minutes cleans the retention right up. Watched four football games on it last weekend and never worried about the stat bars causing any burn in as the commercials were more than enough of a change to protect the screen. No big deal. What you gain with this Plasma is an INCREDIBLE picture. Makes my LCD look terrible by comparison. The picture is WAAAAYYY sharper. The blacks are really black. My LCD the blacks were always kinda grey. Not something I ever really noticed until I got this television. Noticed the reviews here and from B*st B*y prior to my purchase. But also noticed on the other stores reviews that prior to October the reviews for this TV were terrible. After October 2011 the reviews were almost all 5 stars. I am in the automotive repair business myself and it seems to me that Samsung had a bad run on power supplies and relays on the sets built sold in the months prior to last October (2011). I see the same thing in cars. Bad parts in the supply chain. But, that being said, I love mine. Sad to say, but with the economy being as bad as it is, we stay home and watch a lot of  movies. So my set gets about 30 hours or more a week use. Love every minute. Hope you do too!!Update>>>>  May 5th, 2012Just thought I would check in and am happy to report that this tv is still out-performing it's price tag.... :)Update>>>> Finally failed October 2012. Would not turn on anymore.. Replaced w/ a larger Panasonic Plasma..

Reviews.Title: Junk.
Reviews.Author: Chai Uan
Reviews.Content: This TV lasted about 14 days before it would no longer power on. Yes, 14 days. It has been 21 days since I placed my warranty claim. Nothing has been done yet. The warranty service is terrible. I'm writing this review while I'm on hold with customer service. I've been on hold for 30 minutes. A terrible, terrible experience. It's one thing for the TV not to work. It's another thing to completely fail to provide service for a TV that was manufactured in the spring of this year. I would never buy another Samsung product.

Reviews.Title: WARNING!!!!TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE BEWARE TV BROKE
Reviews.Author: Christopher White
Reviews.Content: Bought model PN51D530A3FXZA from Best Buy back in Sept 2011. Yesterday on 12/27/11 while watching TV the screen suddenly just went off. Tried turning it on but no picture only audio. Looked closer and discovered under the front glass there were two internal spider cracks on the screen. There is no external damage. I've read up on this and seems like a common issue Samsung tries to side step responsibility time after time again. I've taken VIDEO of the TV which PROVES that there is no external damage and a TECH is supposed to come by sometime to verify but from reading other posts seems like the techs side with SAMSUNG. Maybe its from how hot the screens get, gasses, who knows but it wasn't due to mishandling by myself or anyone else. I've been a loyal customer with Samsung TV's for years and this is my first ever issue which I hope SAMSUNG will stand up and do the right thing as a Multimillion dollar thriving company should for their paying customers when it's obviously a manufacturing issue and a common one and they know it happens. For some reason I cant post the link to my youtube video but I will happily send to a SAMSUNG CS head. If SAMSUNG still denies from the video and technician I'd like to have head from SAMSUNG come to my house and PROVE it is not a internal issue. One of the worst things is when you pay hard earned full price money for a product and get something inferior in return and basically told by that company Tough Luck or word is everything and your word means crap even if you have HARD proof. I just want it fixed or replaced with a friendly smile.************UPDATE  1/4/12So SAMSUNG is trying to deny that the cause is internal and that I caused the cracks in the TV..But yet they offer to pay for replacement parts as long as I pay for labor which is a few hundred bucks. Clearly SAMSUNG knows that the problem is internal then why even offer to pay for replacement parts. I refuse to have to pay another dime especially for labor on a product that is only 4 months old and still under warranty. I even offered to ship the TV for SAMSUNG to look at and they refused. They never sent a tech in person to look at anything. One of the head CS said that the TV's are actually designed not to show damage on the screen externally and its very possible it was caused by physical mishandling where the internal screen would be damage. Are these guys kidding me what kind of sense does that make. So you design a TV Screen so the external screen is protected but does not protect the screen inetrnally. That's about the dumbest logic ever. Thats like buying a car and u get in a accident where the car's exterior is 100% fine but yet the inside of the car is all kinds of messed up. This is proof along with the HUNDREDS of other same complaints that SAMSUNG who I once considered a FLAGSHIP company operates their customer service like a FLY BY NIGHT paper bag operated corporation. Not only will I be contacting the BETTER BUSINESS BUERAU (which by the way everyone who has this same issue should do) I guess they didn't realize from my email I sent them after they wanted pictures that I work for a WORLD WIDE Major TV network so this will be going around. I will mobilize a class action suit. EVERYONE WHO HAS THIS ISSUE contact me ASAP to build the suit. To think I was once a huge supporter of SAMSUNG products and choose them over SONY, PANASONIC and the other top of the line companies.HERE is a LINK to MANY OTHER CUSTOMERS WITH THE SAME ISSUE!!! [...]

Reviews.Title: Great Plasma TV
Reviews.Author: Arun Jeevanand
Reviews.Content: Its been 2 months since I had this TV. So far so good. Great TV with excellent picture quality. I love the slim edge of this TV. I still need to calibrate it to make the picture quality better. Overall great!Pros:Great picture qualitySamsungGreat lookingCons:Only 2 HDMI ports (not an issue for me as I have a reciever)Sound quality is bit poor at high volume (not an issue for as I have a home theatre :))

Reviews.Title: Samsung Issues
Reviews.Author: NJ Guy "PKS"
Reviews.Content: Hi All,I noticed a lot of folks writing same -ve reviews about Samsung. "The TV suddenly turned off...".Now, I am a Samsung fan and have always had Samsung TV. I also agree that Samsung Support is not at all good.I love Samsung TV. So when I when I had the exact same problem with my plasma TV about a year ago, I was sad. Worst part? It broke right after 3 yr warranty expired :(. I called Samsung for customer service. Point blank - they wanted to charge me almost 200 bucks just to come to my house +parts and labor. I contacted local repairman too. They were a few bucks cheaper but I began contemplating a charge of almost 500 bucks. That didnt sound right since a new TV these days is for 1000 bucks.So, I took matter in my own hands. I am not savvy and would rate myself 30 to 40 out of 100 in electronics. I am 70 to 80 out of 100 in computers so this confidence helped me open the rear end of my TV. Trust me, it wasnt easy. Screws were (I think) intentionally hidden to give you tough time if you chose to DYI. I opened it in about 2 hrs and found about 5 fuzes in the rear end. Left my TV open and went to Radioshack to buy that fuze. Radioshack didnt carry that fuze. Finally landed up ordering the fuzes online - total damage with shipping?.. hold your breadth.. $10. All the while (about a week), My TV laid open on the floor of my basement. (So, dont try this if you are in an apartment with limited space and have kids in the house).I replaced the fuze and wallah.. TV worked. Shame on Samsung(1) For providing poor quality fuzes(2) Make it hard to open the rear TV panel.Thank them for(1) Using fuzes instead of old fashion diodes (which would've required soldering)I still love Samsung TVs. Between price and quality, I do think they are the best.

Reviews.Title: Died in one month!!!!
Reviews.Author: Disappointed!
Reviews.Content: Purchased this set through Vanns.  I recieved it February 3rd, and it worked great until February 29th.  Now it just makes a few clicking noises and won't turn on.  Believe the negative reviews and stay away if you want to avoid a hassle.

Reviews.Title: Big Time on the cheap
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a big TV for awhile now, but not wanting to pay for the 60 and 70 inch models that are running $2,500 or more.  I also didn't want to spend that much with 3D and other technologies possibly rendering my $2,500 obsolete in 3 years.  But I HAD to update/upgrade the 37 inch Insignia I had in the family room.So I went with this Samsung and wow.  You want to talk about picture, about as clear as I have seen with no fuzz or flutter.  If you view a lot in the daytime, watch out for glare, but from dusk 'til dawn, this sucker is crisp & CLEAR.It was easy to set up and looks incredible, no one will mistake this TV for 55 - it looks huge.  We have it in our family room which is open to both the kitchen proper and kitchen table area - no squinting required.  I am amazed at how the picture quality makes it seem even larger - maybe it's just me.  I did purchase an extended warranty since it is a plasma, but for out-the-door at a grand, I am a very happy camper.

Reviews.Title: Worked for 3 Hours!
Reviews.Author: bryan
Reviews.Content: The TV operated for a total of 3 hours in a 13 hour period before it malfunctioned. The TV shut off and won't turn on. It only clicks a few times and flashes a red led. I am obviously VERY upset with this. I will give Samsung a chance to fix this but unless they offer superb customer support and nothing less, will my opinion and review change. Other than that, the picture looked great for the 3 hours, the speakers do cause the metal case to vibrate when any sort of low frequency occurs which is annoying but not a deal breaker. Still, I hate this Tv as of 4 am and 14 hours of ownership.

Reviews.Title: WARNING! The Samsung PN51D530 is a lemon
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for a nice 50+ HDTV. The Samsung PN51D530 was on sale, I read some reviews and have a Samsung Blu Ray player I liked so I thought this would be a good buy and it appeared to have a decent overall rating - although there were a few where users claimed the unit died after a short period of use. I thought those reviews were isolated comments and purchased the unit anyway.  That was a mistake.The product worked as expected - for 14 days. Now, without any warning or hint of trouble, the unit simply will not power on. It clicks a few times but eventually stops resulting in no picture. As stated, I saw this unit reviewed elsewhere and thought it would be a great value.  Check out the other reviews - its true - the PN51D530 is a lemon that works for a few days or weeks and the irreparably crashes. Requesting service with Samsung is also a frustrating exercise.  I would strongly recommend that you do not purchase Samsung PN51D530.

Reviews.Title: piece of sh**!
Reviews.Author: ANTHONY B. CHUN
Reviews.Content: worked great for 3 months then crapped out without any warning.  tv clicks but doesn't turn on.  i went online and discovered that this is a consistent problem with samsung tvs.  and samsung does nothing to address this beyond their 1 year warranty.  no offers to extend warranty, just an offer to send out a service person to "fix" the problem.  i'll be really surprised if the tv lasts beyond a year.  samsung, shame on you for putting a flawed product like this on the market, without any accountability to your customers.NEVER BUY SAMSUNG!

Reviews.Title: Just a bad model by samsung
Reviews.Author: Zachary Raines "zraines"
Reviews.Content: The tv was great.  It worked well but I received a broken remote but still worked.  I turned the tv on for a second time within 5 hours and it turns off and starts clicking to turn back on. It will not work and Returning item.  Dont waste ur time and effort on this model samsung.  I will try the 6500 and 7000 models

Reviews.Title: TV suddenly failed...
Reviews.Author: Jared Wolfert
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in November 2011, it worked great until two weeks ago when the screen suddenly turned off.  Trying to turn it on doesn't help.  Unplugging and plugging in just creates a clicking noise without the screen ever coming on.  The customer service for this is non-existent.  Be careful...a $700 TV should last more than 18 months...buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Barebones, but great for the price.
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV as a black Friday deal for $650 to upgrade my 5 year old 42 inch 720p plasma (also a Samsung). I wanted the bigger screen and 1080p capability. Fair warning, this is a TV only. You won't be able to access the internet w/ it to watch YouTube or stream Netflix directly, but since most of your peripherals probably have those features already, you probably aren't missing out on anything.As other reviewers have pointed out, there are very few inputs, which can be a little annoying, but not a huge deal if you don't have an excessive amount of peripherals attached.One thing I will say about the TV is that it does not produce what's known as "The Soap Opera Effect" onto the picture that you see with most HDTV's these days, where everything looks like it was shot on an ultra-HD camcorder. Whether you think that's a good thing or not, really depends on your taste as a viewer. Personally, I'm not a fan of it. To me, those images look, for lack of a better term, "too real". The picture on the TV is crisp and clean, and the colors look great, but it won't fool anybody if you were to play one of those HD aquarium or fireplace scenes on it.As far as sound goes, I couldn't tell you, since it was immediately hooked up to my surround sound system and i don't think I've ever used the TV's internal speakers. But, I can't imagine it would sound great, since they've probably sacrificed speaker quality for screen size and to keep a thin profile.I can't speak for these other reviewers who've had problems with theirs, but I've been logging quite a bit of time on mine since November and haven't had any issues. Knock on wood.Overall it's a good TV for the value, but does not have all the bells and whistles that higher price TV's of this size do. In hindsight, I'd recommend it to anyone looking to get a good TV on a modest budget, but unless space is an obstacle, I'd splurge a few hundred more bucks and get a 55-60 inch screen instead.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY SAMSUNG 530!
Reviews.Author: OhioBobcat
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money/time on this unreliable piece of junk. I did not listen to the poor reviews, bought this TV from a well known department store and it failed to power on 3 DAYS later. Same problem as the other negative reviews. This particular TV is terribly faulted and should not be sold. Criminal! Picture quality and exterior of this TV are great but do yourself a favor and buy any Samsung but this one.

Reviews.Title: Horrible TV and worse Customer Service
Reviews.Author: michael l mclaughlin
Reviews.Content: This TV is a complete Lemon, We were watching a dvd one saturday and there was a pop then the screen went blank with a buzzing noise then a crack appears on the screen. The sound of the DVD was still playing but no picture and still a buzz over it. SO we call Samsung they give us a ticket number and tell us someone will contact us in 24hrs. Well 2 days later we call back and they give us the run around. We were told that due to our issue we would not be covered under warranty. Mind you we got our TV placed it in the entertainment center and didn't touch it, then pop no TV. We have called everyone in the Samsung office who could help and still nothing. Buyer beware you are getting a Piece of Crap if you purchase this TV, Stick with Panasonic or if you have the budget Sony!!! We are now out 700 and have no TV, Thanks Samsung whatever happened to the customer is always right?.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it. No support from Samsung
Reviews.Author: John Rogers
Reviews.Content: I bought this plasma tv 17 months ago and it just shut down. Samsung basically says that you are on your own. No help at all. Did not qualify for the class action lawsuit for their previous years plasmas. Does the clicking, and does not turn on. Samsung says call a repairman. My sony tv has worked flawlessly for 20+ years, and the Samsung couldn't make it 2 years. Waste of money buying Samsung. Unfortunately we bought their blu-ray dvd player. What a piece of junk that is. Has trouble with 10% of the dvd's we tried.No more Samsung products ever!

Reviews.Title: Beware
Reviews.Author: Roger Edel
Reviews.Content: Bought it 1/25/12. It died 6/07/13. What has happened to the television makers in the last 15 years?! I have owned one piece of junk after another! DO NOT BUY! It will shut off one day, just like the others and you will be writing something along these lines... I mean it seems like tv's have an internal self destruct button built into them these days that triggers a month or two beyond the warranty. A tv should make the two year mark for @!$% sake!

Reviews.Title: 59" D530
Reviews.Author: SkaPig
Reviews.Content: We have the 59" version of the D530.  I do not think the 59" version is subject to the same power source failures as the 51" version that seems to be bringing down the rating.This plasma has decent black levels and great color.  Amazing plasma for the price.  Very few inputs compared to other models, so make sure you can make do with just one component/composite and two HDMI before ordering.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the money
Reviews.Author: MAD MAX
Reviews.Content: WOW! What an incredible TV. I was looking for a plasma that didn't have all the features that always cause them to break down before their time. This is that TV. And the price was perfect as well. It is loaded with all the necessary features to have an excellent viewing experience. I didn't care about the speakers because I have a kick butt 7.1 surround system. The picture quality, although the factory settings need tweaking, is as good or better than any other plasma I looked at. My friend has a Pioneer, which is argue-ably the best TV out, and my picture is better hands down.

Reviews.Title: Some good stuff, some bad stuff.
Reviews.Author: A. Samaniego "Alexito"
Reviews.Content: I've written a few comments under other reviews but here's my thing:I bought this thing in November, it was a ganga. I think I got it for just over $600 right here on Amazon. So far it's been nice and has worked well. I keep reading these terrible reviews (so many of them) so I decided to get an extended 4-year warranty for $100. Be that as it may. As I said so far the TV has worked fine, picture is awesome, sound is good.There is one little issue that I've found so far in regards to the screen. When I watch recorded material off of my DVR, I notice a single white line at the very top of the screen. The line is horizontal and runs the length of the television. It doesn't bother me much since it's at the very very top, I mean any further up and it would be off the screen. I notice also that it happens only on material recorded on non-HD channels so maybe it's a picture size issue?The other thing that has now really bothered me is the minimal amount of inputs that the TV has:2 HDMI1 USB1 Component INput (RCA) - yes, only 1.1 Digital audio output (optical) TOSLINKAnd one that looks to be a mini-headphone type jack, but it is called "SERVICE."THAT IS IT. No other outputs.I normally wouldn't have an issue since I only need the 2 HDMI for my DirecTV and BlueRay player, and the component cables for my Wii. But recently I bought some Sennheiser wireless headphones and had no way to hook them up. I tried everything I could imagine without having to buy more equipment but was unable to hook them up directly to the TV.The component (RCA) cables are "input" so no sound going out. The TOSLINK jack is really odd-looking and Sennheiser told me I would need some adapter for it. And what Samsung claims is a mini-heaphone jack (that in reality is called "service") doesn't really work, or at least I get no sound out of it if I hook up my headphones to it. I had to hook them up directly to my DirecTV box (since that has a lot of input/output choices).I really don't understand why such a new TV would have such limited amount of input/output options. Seems rather... lazy? Was it a design flaw and they didn't notice it until thousands of these were built?

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Ashley Workman
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a tv to purchase over the holiday season on black friday week. Read the reviews on Amazon and i was very skeptical on wether to purchase this or not. I wanted the best size and picture for the money. Gained as much knowledge as i could about the diffrences in display types. Found that a plasma was the absolute best choice. This set is used for gaming and family movie nights. During my research i found a lot of information that nobody seems to mention. Break in procedure for a plasma of 100-200 hrs and how calibration plays a role into the image retention issues. After setting my tv up i let it run a break-in cd which flashes diffrent colored images on loop. If we weren't watching the tv and we were up the unit would be running the cd. Calibrated the unit after a few days of this procedure. I have watch movies on widescreen and fell asleep accidently with a menu on. No harm done. The only time a image was retained was during the first couple days in a long video game session in which there was a white symbol on the screen for a long period of time. The white symbol was barely visible when the screen was black. Used the white sliding bars to reset the screen and all is well again. All the hook ups were exactly as described.

Reviews.Title: Ok so far
Reviews.Author: J Hilton "WaterEd"
Reviews.Content: On Black Friday I ordered the samsung and a 24 in monitor for my Office.The Samsung has a great picture and does seem to have a better picture than my Panasonic 50 inch plasma.I have seen the reviews and so far I am happy with the Samsung. (Cnet has great reviews also).The issue with the inputs was not a problem as I have ordered a HDMI box ($12) on Amazon.Amazon prime saves you $40 on shipping. (Great value)

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: SagBo
Reviews.Content: I ordered this 59" plasma just in time for Thanksgiving football!  The TV turns on and that's it.  There is absolutely no pic!  You can't even see the menu.  Tomorrow is Thanksgiving and no pic.  I tried Samsung chat and they conclude the TV needs to be serviced.  I'm not servicing a new TV!  RUKM.  Take it back!

Reviews.Title: Typical samsung ----- will have problems after one year
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: It won't play video from Samsung galaxy note which is also having problem( battery drain, screen flickering ) after one year.As a software developer, I have to say that Samsung does a much better job in advertisement than products which will have problem right after warranty always!

Reviews.Title: minor sugestions
Reviews.Author: charles church
Reviews.Content: the only problem is not enough inputs for composit video.most people dont have equipment with HDMI out puts at this time.

Reviews.Title: Sansung TV
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: The best gift for my mother, this TV is perfect, the sharp image and the ideal size. I recommend it. thanks

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Tommy Norton
Reviews.Content: I love this tv I would definitely recommend it to anyone. Great price for everything it does. I would probably stick with Samsung for tvs from now on.

Reviews.Title: It's been over a year
Reviews.Author: E. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I am happy with the quality of this television.  I have not had any troubles with it. I had been warned about plasmas overheating, but that is not the case for us. The only thing that could be better is if it had more HDMI connections; this one only has two and I am constantly unplugging one thing to plug in another. A small matter for a quality television.

Reviews.Title: delivered as promised
Reviews.Author: jeff kort
Reviews.Content: our tv died and we needed a quick replacement.  We found this along with all of the options we wanted at the price we liked.  It shipped quickly and came with appropriate, easy to follow instructions and a contact opportunity for any issues we might incur.  We are very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture!
Reviews.Author: Ryan B. Partlow
Reviews.Content: It is a great TV for the price.  1 star off because it has a glass screen so it has reflection issues.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture......while it had a picture
Reviews.Author: Redd Bird "ReddBird"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Best Buy even after reading the reviews, some of which provided accounts of the TV simply powering off losing the picture. I should have re-read those reviews before I bought. That's exactly what happened to my set. It worked just fine for 10 months. The picture was excellent with deep blacks, white whites and great contrast. The sound was pretty good too for built in speakers. In the tenth month of service, we were all gather round watching a movie when we began to notice a flickering in the bright parts of the picture which was coming from my cable TV provider. I thought it might be something on their end that would eventually stop. A few minutes later we switched to Netflix and the problem followed. About 15 minutes after we noticed the flashing, the TV just died, shutting itself off. When I powered it up I could here a clicking noise but no picture. After several clicks there would be silence. I tried unplugging the unit and reconnecting. All this did was produce the same clicking but no picture. Since the set was still under the 1 year warranty, I called Samsung service. It took a week for a technician to show up. He brought two circuit boards which he installed. Then the moment of truth....he plugged in the TV and I heard the musical sound it makes just before there is a picture. I was elated but for naught. Almost immediately, the TV powered off on its own. The technician just sat there shaking his head. He told me that he would have to replace the plasma screen but it had to be ordered since he didn't have one on his truck. That was 2 1/2 weeks ago and still the parts have not arrived. I called Samsung to ask about replacing the set since it's still under warranty but they pretty much squashed that idea saying that the plasma screen would fix the problem. From what I've read in the reviews, this is a common problem. Therefore, it is my recommendation that you don't buy this model TV. I certainly will never buy another Samsung product. I don't trust them anymore.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Soldier
Reviews.Content: This TV is fantastic! I upgraded from a Panasonic plasma and this blows it away. Pros: BIG SCREEN! Small frame. My wife is very particular about the aesthetics and you barley notice the frame or the stand.  The ports are adequate unless you have everything plus your toaster hooked up to it.  The price is unbeatable as most can pay cash for it rather than putting it on a card.  Cons: as with all plasmas, it's a little hard to see in bright light, but the TV has a three picture mode to change to for best viewing. Speakers are weak, but this is normal for all flat screens. You should be using surround sound anyway. Remote is also adequate, but again, use a more advanced all-in-one type. Overall, best plasma for the price on the market. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Wander
Reviews.Content: I read The bad reviews on this TV and was scare to buy it but im happy I brought it. I have had this TV for 2 Months And have had no problems with it so far. This TV is used around 12 hours a day. The Picture, brightness and contrast are very excellent! for the price it's a excellent TV

Reviews.Title: Samsung PN51D530
Reviews.Author: FSA
Reviews.Content: Slim, energy efficient, clear captivating pictures and a smooth sound system, it is precious and keeps my family and visitors tight to their seats in our seating room

Reviews.Title: Do not buy a Samsung PN51D530 - it is a lemon.
Reviews.Author: disappointed
Reviews.Content: This model must be a lemon.  It broke within the third week.  Samsung replaced it in October 2011, and it failed again in April 2012.  The problem is similar to what others have experienced.  It just clicks 10 times when you plug it in, but will not turn on.  Don't even think about this model.

Reviews.Title: Two months and still goin strong
Reviews.Author: Kdg72712
Reviews.Content: Works great! I have not had the bad luck as some other reviewers on here. This TV is great and has an amazing picture. The only surprise I had was no LAN or Wifi at all. I'm OK with that since I have connected my BD player to Ethernet, so I really don't require another one at the TV. This is also a very slim unit and looks pretty nice mounted on the wall. Would buy this again! I really have no complaints that aren't from user error, or preferences because of my own environment. The product works as expected, and beyond!Buyers be aware that this doesn't have internet connectivity. The next model up from this unit does have it, that's the only difference.

Reviews.Title: Nice Plasma 51"
Reviews.Author: antonio p. senteno
Reviews.Content: Damm this 51" samsung tv. Looks great.. I was undecisive between Lcd, and plasma. But i made a great choice for the money 51" under $700 bucks..Ofcourse if money wasnt the issue i would of splurred on "LED"

Reviews.Title: So far I'm very pleased
Reviews.Author: Casey Cox
Reviews.Content: I just received this TV yesterday and was impressed with the shipping service.  It took about 7 to 8 days to ship, not too bad considering it's an 88lb TV, but the carrier impressed me with service.  I was initially a little concerned when I saw the carrier was CEVA, who I had never heard of before, but the delivery man was nice and setup the TV for me. This service is part of the white glove service that Amazon offered for free with this delivery.Now, the TV looks awesome even on low brightness and contrast, due to break-in period for plasmas. I have only had the TV for around 2 days, but from what I've seen, I am more than happy with the purchase. The picture is absolutely amazing with Battlefield 3 and other HD inputs; definitely happy with the plasma decision over LCD. As long as the TV keeps working, I will only have great things to say about this product.Pros:Price-cheapPicture-incredible 1080psize-huge 51"low profile bezelCons:very few inputs(2 HDMI, 1 Component, 1 Optical)The low number of inputs isn't a big deal as you could, and should, use a surround sound system with a TV like this. You also can't expect great sound out of such a low profile TV, but, once again the surround sound will take care of any sound issues.EDIT: This TV has an incredible picture after a few minor tweaks to the picture settings!

Reviews.Title: So far good
Reviews.Author: Carl E Graves
Reviews.Content: This TV looks good and mine performs properly.However, there is a glare issue with this TV for anyone who will be placing it opposite a window. Also, there are a limited number of inputs if that is an issue for you.Despite some negatives, this is a great price for a decent TV.

Reviews.Title: Very limited input capability
Reviews.Author: L. Moss
Reviews.Content: This TV has very limited inputs. There is only one analog input. It can take a component or standard AV (yellow plug) but not both. Thus if you have a VCR and an analog (non hdmi) DVD you can't hook up both.While there are 2 HDMI inputs, if you use the PC (VGA) input, you can  only use 1 HDMI.This is a fine TV if you can live with those restrictions.

Reviews.Title: Worked for 2 days, then click click click, it's dead.
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for my 86 year old mom.  It worked for 2 days and then shut itself off.  While it worked it was the best picture she ever saw.  Sorry mom.

Reviews.Title: So Far So GREAT!!!  Read this review, it is the TRUTH!!!
Reviews.Author: TJ Rowbotham
Reviews.Content: I actually bought this TV from Best Buy a week ago for $650+ sales tax.  It is originally $1,000 but the model is about 1 year old.  There is no reason to trust these other "Reviews" through Amazon.  Everybody is complaining about a broken remote or limited capability, and nothing to do with the stated performance.  Well they should have done their homework.  This is a basic 51" Plasma TV.  Plasmas do have a glossy cover and this is why it is better to have them in non-direct light areas, it is not the TV's fault that buyers don't do their homework.  Another brilliant reciew was that "all Samsungs" are junk and don't buy them, actually they are rated the #2 recommended Plasma and #1 LED for the past 3 years.Either way, do your own homework.  Don't read these garbage, lazy reviews of people who were too lazy to go to the store and actually see the TV's.  This TV is AWESOME.  It has limited capabilities, but if you have a stereo you run your TV cable, DVD, and Music out of you are all set.  New TV's are not supposed to have big speakers like the old tube TV's, they are supposed to provide a picture with adequate sound, thats it.I would recommend this Samsung Plasma TV to my mother.  If you do your homework, you realize this is an AWESOME deal and for $650+ a TV stand you have a great set up for $750.  So sorry your TV is built properly, the specidications did not lie, and it makes you feel better to rip a TV becuase you are dumb.  If you do your homework you know this is a great TV deal.

Reviews.Title: Comes with a complimentary independent study in electrical engineering!
Reviews.Author: A. Hodge
Reviews.Content: The reviews don't lie. I was a fan of Samsung displays and electronics, having nothing but good experiences first with a PC monitor, which is 9-10 years old, and my 32" 720p LCD TV, going on 6-7 years in age. I expected similar performance and longevity out of this TV. The performance was there. The longevity wasn't.After performing dutifully since late 2011, about a month ago I come home and turn the TV on, and it refuses to start. I seem to recall paying in the 700ish range for this. A 700 dollar appliance should last longer than 20 months.Apparently Samsung has had quality control problems with parts and capacitors since 2008, and indeed they copped to it in some of their earlier models (after a class action lawsuit). Unfortunately, this particular TV was not included in that lawsuit, and Samsung won't do crap. Obviously they're skimping on customer service as well as quality control. (Which makes me wonder where the profits ARE going... oh, right, CEO pockets.)Now I'm left trying to fix this 700 dollar 51" paperweight. I think I've narrowed the source of the problem down to the X Main board, although all the capacitors there look good, and I don't feel like buying a soldering iron or a multimeter, so I think I'll just replace the whole board with parts from eBay and hope that brings it back. If you're saying to yourself, "X Main huh? Capacitor who? Multimeter what now?" Don't worry! So was I, a month ago. See all the fun things you'll get to learn about if you buy this great TV?As for me, needless to say, I'll never buy a Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: Broke after 5 weeks
Reviews.Author: RocketScientist
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else in this review section for this product, my TV suddenly stopped working after 5 weeks.  I called Samsung to get it fixed, since it conveniently broke after the BestBuy return policy ended, and they said they would have the repairman call me within 48 hours to set a repair time to fix my TV.  He never called. I'm pretty pissed that I bought a lemon and Samsung won't even come out and fix it.UPDATE: BestBuy finally fixed my screen, and wouldn't you believe it not a week later and I have two rows of dead pixels running across the brand new panel they installed!

Reviews.Title: no picture
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: Had a new Samsung 51 inch TV delivered just in time for Bowl games. I set it up and have no picture, called Samsung and have to wait until Jan 4 for somebody to repair it. If it was a car I could get a rental. Will never buy a Samsong again.

Reviews.Title: What a DEAL
Reviews.Author: KKS "KKS"
Reviews.Content: This had all of the requirements I wanted: Plasma, 600hz, 50 inches or larger, and less than $650.Great TV. The power button of the front is "electrostatic", you do not have a real button but actually touch the plastic edge and the power come on. It is more thin than my Panasonic 50" that I purchased 4 years ago for $2500. It looks great hanging on my bedroom wall.

Reviews.Title: Just don't buy this TV
Reviews.Author: jl
Reviews.Content: My tv is one week old ! the power turn off by ITself last night ! Try to unplug ,try to turn on again then just a click on and off .Call to Samsung ! they will send somebody next week to change some parts !One week with no TV.My first and last Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Lemon -- raises many questions
Reviews.Author: Consumer
Reviews.Content: Within the first 24 hours of use this television made a clicking noise and abruptly turned off.  I was unable to power it up again.  When I contacted the manufacturer they didn't sound at all surprised.  It's shocking that such an apparently frequent and obvious problem like this could get past even the most basic of product quality testing protocols.  It's obviously going back.  But this experience has to make one wonder.How exactly does soemthing like this happen?  What will Samsung do in response?  Does soemone get fired when this happens?  Might it have been a decent TV save for this problem or would it be more likely to have more problems?  How come even highly rated manufacturers have some models that are great but others like this that are duds?  Are all of these new televsions getting to fancy for their own darn good?  Is the career of television repair person coming back?  Is this really a secret jobs program?  What will happen to all of these returned televisions?  How many of the delivery trucks we see everyday on the road are carrying malfunctioning products back and forth?  Do I need a television?

Reviews.Title: Poor luck with this TV
Reviews.Author: John Morris
Reviews.Content: This tv lasted 26 months before it needed $350 repair for "a couple of boards".To be fair I bought it from Best Buy, not Amazon.Called Samsung and asked for some help with the repair costs.They said no. It's off warranty an they won't assist me.I won't be buying Samsung products.

Reviews.Title: Disregard poor ratings
Reviews.Author: p_hope
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review on Amazon before but after reading the reviews on this 51" Samsung plasma, I feel obligated to help lift the star rating of this TV.  I really took a chance on this purchase as I usually do not purchase anything on Amazon with less than 4 stars. If you are comparing similar tv's and this one is less $$ DO NOT be afraid to make this purchase!! I paid $650 and am not disappointed in the least.  The picture is nice.  My husband and two older sons LOVE to watch sports on the tv and the movies that we have watched, whether dvd or bluray, look great!

Reviews.Title: Why does Amazon offer $80 off 3D glasses promotion on NON-3D tv????

Reviews.Content: I contacted customer service (Amazon) to notify them of the mistake...that the $80 off 2 sets of 3D glasses is not valid on this, PN59D530, model due to it NOT having 3D functionality about Nov 14, but this has not been corrected.I mentioned that this promotion was probably meant to be applied to the PN5D550 as the 51 and 64 inch versions of the D550 series are in the promotion...but again, no correction thus far.Promotion expires Dec 3.Guess you could apply the promotion and sell the glasses on Craigslist perhaps?
